snippet: Former Mayor Kwame M. Kilpatrick apologized for putting the people of his city through a corruption scandal so vast that prosecutors say it accelerated Detroit’s march toward bankruptcy.
abstract: Former Detroit mayor Kwame M Kilpatrick is sentenced to 28 years in prison for corruption including racketeering, fraud and extortion; apologizes for putting city's residents through scandal so vast that prosecutors say it accelerated Detroit’s march toward bankruptcy.
lead_paragraph: Former Mayor Kwame M. Kilpatrick apologized for putting the people of his city through a corruption scandal so vast that prosecutors say it accelerated Detroit’s march toward bankruptcy.

headline.main: Kwame M. Kilpatrick, Former Detroit Mayor, Sentenced to 28 Years in Corruption Case
headline.print_headline: Ex-Mayor Sentenced to 28 Years in Corruption Case That Helped Detroit Go Broke
